text: was a town located in Monbetsu District, Abashiri Subprefecture (now Okhotsk Subprefecture), Hokkaido, Japan. As of 2004, the town had an estimated population of 2,618 and a population density of 9.73 persons per km². The total area was 269.10 km². On October 1, 2005, Ikutahara, along with the town of Maruseppu, and the village of Shirataki (all from Monbetsu District), was merged into the expanded town of Engaru. Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hokkaido
title: Ikutahara, Hokkaido
